item.title: RuneScape Classic update
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

MrPotatoHead:

Jagex running private servers?..hmmmmm…that would mean you could run your own hacked client wouldn’t it? And they would get the ip address from that?

No it wouldn’t. These are private RSC-only servers that are rented out by individuals. You have very limited customization abilities and some sort of administration panel. You would still be using their client and software to do everything. I can see them having some sort of list of servers like how Valve does it with CS:S. Then again, that would make them ‘public’ servers, not ‘private’.

MrPotatoHead:

Did anyone read where it said they use java on their servers?

They have confirmed this many times in forum posts, news articles, and development blogs. Their game server software is written in Java and uses a custom scripting language called RuneScript.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape Classic update
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Jagex running private servers?..hmmmmm…that would mean you could run your own hacked client wouldn’t it? And they would get the ip address from that?

By having the option of renting servers, they are basically trying to put private servers out of buisness once and for all, they can try to sue you because effectively your causing them to loose money.

One thing i never liked about jagex is their appetite to criminalise youngsters, what they forget though, is that if your under 18, you are a minor and not responsible for your actions, they can’t wait until your over 18 to prosecute you either, unless it is classed as a ‘serious’ offence, like murder. I’m not even sure they are allowed to contact you directly with a dmca notice if you are a minor, your not responsible enough to understand what that is.

If they stopped trying to prosecute youngsters and tried engaging the talents within the hacking community, they might have a shot at renting custom GAME servers to people that have some clue about what they are doing. Doubt they ever will though, they are just desperate for money at the minute, someone went and pissed it all away on hookers and paying for no-hope graduates to blow smoke up their ass.

Did anyone read where it said they use java on their servers?

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape Classic update
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Old Rsc Player:

Its going to be shit, they should just rehost rsc themselves but use there knowledge to make the game how it use to be, seriously, u have 500 employees who most of them have gone to college, are very smart in some way, but none of them can figure out how to stop a simple bot or bring back the game to how it use to be?

They don’t care about bringing back enough to spend anymore resources on “fixing” it to that extent. All they are doing at this point is making it compatible with their new login and chat servers, then setting up who-knows-what to allow remote modifications of the content. But they aren’t going to spend days of employee time just thinking out what could be done to stop bots in a game that barely brings income in. It would be a larger loss to Jagex to bring it back like that than to just remove it and get on with life.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape Classic update
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

abraham2119:

[quote]How about if players could rent and administer their own Classic servers? As a server owner, you could enable or disable any cheat codes you liked, add people to the invite list or banned list, or give individual friends any privileges you liked within your world. In this way, the activities of macroers would become pointless, as you could go on to a cheating-enabled world and get all the stuff you wanted for free if you wanted, but there would still be worlds where you’d have the satisfaction of knowing you worked for your stuff. I should explain that your character would be saved separately for each world, so you couldn’t cheat on one world then use the stuff you gained on a non-cheating world. The different rules set by the owner of each world would really make each world a different game, with different people in positions of power, wielding cheat codes and unleashing Classic’s most awesome spells and items, or making everyone work to get ahead…

i didnt see that coming

but as you can see, they are renting private servers. id like to see how the system will work, if they will let you edit snippets of code, or simply have a set of commands that you are limited to

either way, itll be a good show[/quote]
It’s probably going to be like when you rent a Source game server, or any game server. They just give you a control panel and a few in-game commands. You don’t actually see any source/config.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape Classic update
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

How about if players could rent and administer their own Classic servers? As a server owner, you could enable or disable any cheat codes you liked, add people to the invite list or banned list, or give individual friends any privileges you liked within your world. In this way, the activities of macroers would become pointless, as you could go on to a cheating-enabled world and get all the stuff you wanted for free if you wanted, but there would still be worlds where you’d have the satisfaction of knowing you worked for your stuff. I should explain that your character would be saved separately for each world, so you couldn’t cheat on one world then use the stuff you gained on a non-cheating world. The different rules set by the owner of each world would really make each world a different game, with different people in positions of power, wielding cheat codes and unleashing Classic’s most awesome spells and items, or making everyone work to get ahead...
i didnt see that coming

but as you can see, they are renting private servers. id like to see how the system will work, if they will let you edit snippets of code, or simply have a set of commands that you are limited to

either way, itll be a good show

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape Classic update
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:24, topic:302434”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=398758.msg2959225#msg2959225 date=1253052227]

If we could actually have the source code, or at least a simple scripting system for this i’d love it. Imagine making servers completely different from eachother!

That would be cool, but I’d be willing to bet it will be a cold day in hell before we see any jagex source code released.

I’d say it will be like someone mentioned above, they will host servers on their hardware and give the renter a little control panel to turn features on or off.
[/quote]

I like speljohan’s idea about a simple scripting system. That would be better then anything else.[/quote]
you forget that jagex caters to children that cry and moan when something isn’t extremely easy… Just look at how they changed the entire game for them

Read full topic
